thread.title: USO San Diego’s 5th Annual Golf Classic
thread.title_full: USO San Diego’s 5th Annual Golf Classic

title: USO San Diego’s 5th Annual Golf Classic
text:
USO San Diego’s 5th Annual Golf Classic Where 
8:30 a.m. Tuesday, Nov. 3, 2015 Categories 
Events, Fundraisers, Outdoors | Recreation USO San Diego, whose mission is to lift the spirits of America’s troops and their families, has scheduled its 5th Annual Golf Classic for November 3, 2015. The tournament will be held at the Crosby National Golf Club in Rancho Santa Fe located at 17102 Bing Crosby Blvd, San Diego, CA 92127. Registration opens at 8:30 a.m. and tee time begins at 10:30 a.m. Community leaders, companies, and organizations are invited to come show their support for service members and military families. Proceeds from the tournament will support USO San Diego’s free programs and services for the local military community. The Golf Classic includes a complimentary lunch and local beer for all participants. Event highlights include the opportunity to play golf with a Wounded Warrior or Service Member and a chance to win a brand new GLA250 Mercedes-Benz for the first hole-in-one! In addition to a great day on the private golf course, the first three-placed teams are invited to play in the 2016 Randy Jones Invitational Tournament. For more information and to register for the tournament please go to www.usosandiego.org About the USO San Diego Since 1941, USO San Diego’s mission is to lift the spirits of America’s troops and their families. USO San Diego served the San Diego military community more than 260,000 times in 2014 through our centers, programs, and services. With our two centers, USO San Diego Downtown Center and USO Neil Ash Airport Center, we create a cooperative relationship between U.S. military communities and the civilian community. Our volunteers are incredibly dedicated, donating more than 34,000 hours of their time in 2014. USO San Diego is a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization relying on the generosity of volunteers and donors. To learn more about USO San Diego and our patriotic mission, please visit usosandiego.org.
